Yes, the Oculus Quest 2 is a standalone VR gaming headset, which means it does not require a connection to a computer or gaming console to operate. It has its own processor, memory, and storage built-in, and it runs on the Android operating system. However, it can also be connected to a computer via a USB cable to access additional features and content through the Oculus Link feature. The Oculus Link feature allows users to play PC VR games on their Oculus Quest 2 and use it as a PC VR headset.

Additionally, the Oculus Quest 2 can be connected to a gaming console using the Oculus Air Link feature which allows users to play some console games on the Quest 2 wirelessly.

It should be noted that in order to use the features such as Oculus Link or Oculus Air Link, the computer or gaming console must meet the minimum system requirements.
